item.title: Graffiti sprayed on black shoo shutter at 296-298 Brixton road SW9 6AG. The graffiti is on both front and side of the shutter. Has been there for over a week, 4th September
item.description:
I like to report graffiti sprayed on a black shop shutter at 296-298 Brixton road SW9. The shop is vacant. Unfortunately when graffiti this large is displayed more opportunists see it and spray alongside it. All the other graffiti sprayed on shop shutters have been removed and have vastly improved the main road. Please could this graffiti be removed it be very much appreciated.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 296,298, Brixton Road, Brixton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Second floor savernake house (second entrance at the end) the bin shoot and hallway area, 4th September
item.description:
The communal bin shoot fills up on occasion. I’ve noticed maggots coming up from there and the maggots are now roaming freely on the walkway/communal/hallway area to the point it’s coming to my front door and it makes me nervous theyre going to enter homes
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Woodberry Down Estate, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very difficult for children to cross pedestrian crossing, 4th September
item.description:
E-bikes, e-scooters, bicycles and cars do not stop at the traffic lights.We take our children to Shacklewell primary school and have got nearly run over several times at the shacklewell lane and Amhurst road junction.It is not safe for us or our children.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Amhurst Terrace, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tenants dumping rubbish, 4th September
item.description:
Rail Sidings Rd. Ongoing problem here and needs monitoring with routine checks by the council or their contractors . Multiple black bags, bed and matress dumped almost 2 weeks ago by the resident of no 70 . Others have added to the pile since. Unfortunate Homeless people and drug addicts have been rifling through the bags to find clothing and anything of use to them. Its not only a disgusting eyesore, its attracting the foxes and rats, and is a general heath and fire hazard. The area needs to be CLEARED, SWEPT AND DISINFECTED asap. The alcoves are used as public toilets mainly from outsidets visiting the " Beer mile " and it stinks of urine. The usual scenario is that when these collections are made, the operatives take the bulk and leave behind the residual mess and rubble. How is this acceptable ??

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Rail Sidings Road, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Overflowing bin, 4th September
item.description:
This bin is outside our school and it is an eyesore, it has been like this for a week now. This is not the first time I have had to report this, could this please be emptied as a priority, there is empty food containers which will encourage vermin

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Vernham Road, Shooters Hill, London

item.title: Missed bin collection, 4th September
item.description:
These bibs haven’t been collected for 2 weeks and people are coming along and dumping bags onto the pile. I live next to the alley and regularly going out to tidy up ripped bags by foxes and witnessed rats running around today.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ruskin Drive, Welling, London

item.title: Car has been abandoned for months, 4th September
item.description:
The car pictured has been abandoned for months outside 19 Park Gardens. It's not roadworthy due to the damage that is on it. This has been reported several times to due to the fact that it is causing access and parking issues on an already tight road and is an accident waiting to happen. Please can this now be escalated, notice needs to be served with removal to follow.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Park Gardens, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lump in pavement, 4th September
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Alexandra Crescent, Plaistow, London

item.title: Van load of rubbish/builders rubble bags has been dumped in the carpark outside block 113-143, 4th September
item.description:
As per photos rubbish has been dumped in the middle of the carpark. A resident saw it happen but the van sped off. We have moved it to the side so that it is out of the way of cars that require access

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 145a, Brenchley Gardens, Nunhead, London
